name: tentativeness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of not being certain or confident: The team's tentativeness at the start was understandable. See
tentative
More examplesFewer examplesHer tentativeness seems natural for someone who hasn't been onstage in a couple of decades.There was a tentativeness in some of her singing, an understandable unwillingness to let her voice flow. At first there was an understandable tentativeness about his captaincy.He is disarming in his tentativeness , his modesty, his self-doubt. There is also tentativeness among voters, who worry about his experience and ability to get elected.
